alert.note: Alert for McCulloch (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 01 at 4:25PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern McCulloch County through 515 PM CDT... At 424 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Brady Lake, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Camp San Saba around 505 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include The Intersection Of Us-190 And Ranch Road 1311. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
